statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description:
Paul Pierce scored 36 points -- including four
straight in the second overtime to give Boston the lead for good --
as the Celtics defeated the Atlanta Hawks 105-98 Friday night.
article.headline: Walker has triple-double in Celtics' victory
article.linkText: Celtics' dynamic duo lead Boston to 2OT win
article.story:
BOSTON (AP) -- The Boston Celtics learned last spring that no deficit is too big to overcome.
Walker

Pierce

Applying lessons learned in Game 3 of the Eastern Conference Finals when they overcame a 21-point deficit to defeat New Jersey, the Celtics overcame a 14-point fourth-quarter deficit to beat the Atlanta Hawks 105-98 in double overtime Friday night. ``We know we have a team that thrives being down,'' said Celtics forward Paul Pierce, who scored 36 points, including four straight in the second overtime to cement the win. ``Guys sucked it up and got it done.'' The teams went into the second overtime tied at 94 after Pierce was unable to convert on a drive to the basket with 1 second left in the first overtime. Tony Battie gave the Celtics a 96-94 lead, and Shareef Abdur-Rahim tied the game before Pierce hit back-to-back shots to put the Celtics up for good. ``They made a run,'' said Abdur-Rahim, who scored 22 points. ``I guess we didn't execute down the stretch. We turned the ball over too many times and they were more aggressive at the end.'' Antoine Walker had 27 points, 11 rebounds and 10 assists for his 12th career triple-double. Pierce added 14 rebounds. The Celtics trailed by as many as 14 in the fourth quarter, but used an 11-0 run, sparked by 3-pointers from Walker and Tony Delk, to cut into the lead. Boston tied the game with 42 seconds left, 89-89, on two free throws by Battie. The Hawks were held scoreless from the field for the final 5:25 of the fourth quarter. ``What a basketball game,'' Celtics coach Jim O'Brien said. ``It's nice to be down all game and not necessarily play your best and then be able to have the outstanding defensive stands we had in the last six to eight minutes of the fourth quarter.'' Battie hit a shot at the end of regulation, but it was waived off due to basket interference. Battie had a season-high 18 points with 12 rebounds. The Hawks took their biggest lead, 81-67, on Jason Terry's free throw with 9:19 left in regulation. Glenn Robinson scored 19 of his 25 points in the first half and added 12 rebounds. Terry contributed 19 points and a game-high 12 assists. ``At first I got some good looks, some open looks, in the first half,'' Robinson said. ``They were more difficult to find later in the game.'' The teams played to a 49-49 halftime tie after the Celtics trailed by as many as 10 points in the first half. Walker hit a 3-pointer with 50 seconds left to tie the contest before the break. Game notes
The Celtics and Hawks are the only two teams in the NBA with two players averaging better than 20 points per game. The Celtics' Walker and Pierce and the Hawks' Abdur-Rahim and Robinson are among the league's top 20 scorers. ... The Celtics are averaging better than 28 3-pointers a game; no other team is averaging 20. ... Terry hit a 3-pointer from almost halfcourt to close the first quarter and give the Hawks a 26-24 advantage. ... Walker collected his 5,000th NBA rebound in the second quarter. ... Hawks center Theo Ratliff has at least one block in all 12 games.
